paragraphs: Software is eating the world - Marc Andreessen
Industrial Economics & Technology Management student (NTNU '27) specializing in Artificial Intelligence and Finance, currently on exchange at UC Berkeley.
I like building things people find value in, talking to people about how software can help them, and working with highly ambitious and motivated teams.

items.description: Built this website as a blog, inspired by Physical Intelligence's website.
Something very cool and useful is coming ðŸ¤«.

titleParts.value: Building a market making bot from scratch

items.description: Full stack trading bot that streams order book data, simulates the book, quotes with a fixed spread strategy, and records trades in SQLite with a small REST and SSE API on top.

titleParts.value: Joining Zerolytics as a modeling intern

items.description: Working on climate adjusted valuation models, turning a manual analyst workflow into a Python based pipeline that scaled to hundreds of companies.

titleParts.value: Spending a year at UC Berkeley

items.description: Exchange year focused on Deep Neural Networks and Optimization, plus a course project on in context learning and how transformer models pick up new tasks from examples.

titleParts.value: Helping build Tendro in its early days

items.description: Blending product and engineering: analytics for usage and KPIs, competitor and pricing work used in fundraising, and pieces of the production codebase for our first enterprise customers.

titleParts.value: Doggo: My first full stack application in Next.js

items.description: Built a small website that shows pictures of cute dogs
Industrial Economics & Technology Management with an AI and Finance track.

titleParts.value: Crossing the Atlantic on a 33 ft sailing boat

items.description: Six months living on a 1982 sailboat with a friend, sailing from the Caribbean to Florida and back across the Atlantic to Europe. A good test of risk, planning, and not losing your mind at sea.

cta.prefix: If you want to chat about AI, finance, sailing or building things, please

body.prefix: Comfortable with linear algebra, probability, optimization, financial modeling, and modern software tooling in Python, PyTorch, pandas, FastAPI, Next.js, SQL, Docker, Linux, Git, and Zsh, plus
body.linkText: a mix of student roles and case competitions
body.suffix: including work in the Abakus Academic Committee, a START NTNU case win, and side projects ranging from a small apparel venture in high school to the Atlantic crossing.
